title: English Language Experts - Writers (Freelance, Remote, 20+ openings)
description: About the job Job Description English Language Experts Are you excited about writing, research, and language ‚Äî and eager to apply your skills to the future of AI? This is a fully remote, fully flexible role where you decide your schedule. Not only will you be able to implement your writing and language skills in impactful projects, but you‚Äôll also have the opportunity to build passive income forever through our referral program, earning as long as your referred candidates continue working. üìå To ensure the success of your application, we strongly recommend watching our video guide on the application process before applying. The Role: Where Your Language Expertise Meets AI Innovation As an AI Data Trainer, you will: Develop AI Training Content: Create detailed prompts in various topics and responses to guide AI learning, ensuring the models reflect a comprehensive understanding of diverse subjects. Optimize AI Performance: Evaluate and rank AI responses to enhance the model's accuracy, fluency, and contextual relevance. Ensure Model Integrity: Test AI models for potential inaccuracies or biases, validating their reliability across use cases. Bring your expertise - we‚Äôll take care of the rest with a tailored onboarding experience that sets you up for success from day one. Your Profile Apply if this sounds like you (even if not every point applies): You are a student or graduate with a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Linguistics, Communication, or a related field. You have a strong command of written English, with good grammar, syntax, and stylistic versatility. You enjoy doing research, exploring new topics, and turning ideas into clear, structured content. You like creative writing, experimenting with different tones and formats. You bring an analytical mindset and pay attention to detail, delivering quality work independently. You might even have experience with AI/LLM training ‚Äî if so, that‚Äôs a great plus, but it‚Äôs not required. Commitment This is a fully flexible, remote role - you choose when and where you work. To set yourself up for success on the project, it makes sense to dedicate at least 20 hours per week or more, while still keeping a healthy balance that fits your lifestyle.

title: Back End Developer (Ruby on Rails)
description: About the job Job Title: Backend Developer (Ruby on Rails) Location: Fully Remote (Work from anywhere in Japan) Employment Type: Full-time (Regular Employment) Salary: up to 10M JPY/year Japanese Level: Equivalent to JLPT N2 or higher All applicants must be residing in Japan with Valid working visa for foreigners About the Company: A fast-growing tech company in Japan providing a platform that connects individuals with flexible, short-term work opportunities. The service allows people to find jobs that fit their schedules while helping businesses quickly fill staffing needs. With a mission to enrich people‚Äôs time and create new ways of working, the company focuses on leveraging technology to promote flexible employment and address social challenges in the labor market. Key Responsibilities: Design, develop, review, and release web applications using Ruby on Rails. Identify technical issues within and outside the team, propose and implement solutions. Review specifications related to your area of responsibility, and respond to inquiries, including technical research Work with the engineering manager and scrum master to progress projects. Participate in various scrum events held within the team People management and scrum master roles are not included in this job description, as we have specialized members. Ideal Candidate: Shares and aligns with the company‚Äôs mission and vision Demonstrates the company‚Äôs core values in daily work Values teamwork and collaborates effectively with others Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills Highly motivated toward personal and professional growth Requirements: Must-Have: More than 5 years of experience in web application development and operation including 3 years or more of experience in web application development and operation using Ruby on Rails Experience in a series of developments from requirements definition, design, implementation, testing, release, and maintenance Experience in continuous development using software testing Experience in team development using Git Nice-to-Have: Experience with agile development projects using a Scrum system Experience building and operating web applications using AWS or Google Cloud Experience with software architecture design and improvement or middleware selection and implementation Experience with design and improvement that takes performance into consideration when handling large amounts of traffic and data Perks & Benefits: Flextime with no mandatory core hours Full transportation cost coverage (if visiting office occasionally) Health insurance Weekends and national holidays off End of year and New Year holidays Trial period: 6 months (standard) We have more positions available‚Äîif you're open to new opportunities, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply! Job ID: 06626

title: Language Data Quality Reviewer for Korean (Freelance/Task-based)
description: About the job Volga Partners, a U.S.-based company, specializes in Artificial Intelligence and machine learning, catering to top technology giants and multinational corporations. Beyond that, we offer a spectrum of services including IT, business process outsourcing, advanced professional services, and crowdsourcing in both established and emerging markets. Our client is seeking candidates interested in Freelance/Task-based work for an ongoing project. The hours will align with the IST time zone. PLEASE REVIEW THE MANDATORY REQUIREMENT BEFORE APPLYING: Must be able to read and write in Korean and English. Must be comfortable and understand this is a task-based role. Task-Based Project Scope This is a freelance, task-based role designed for those seeking supplemental income. It‚Äôs essential to understand the nature of freelance work‚Äîtasks will be assigned as they become available, and work may be irregular or intermittent. Notifications will be sent via WhatsApp, email, or Slack (after onboarding through the client‚Äôs portal). All tasks are offered on a first-come, first-served basis, making this role ideal for individuals who are comfortable with flexible, on-demand work. Mandatory Requirements Must have reliable high-speed internet and a functioning device (laptop, desktop, etc.) to ensure seamless communication and productivity. Urgency: Due to the nature of the role, it is essential that all candidates have these resources in place from day one to avoid any delays in onboarding or task completion. POSITION We are looking for a Language Data and Quality Reviewer with proficiency in Korean and English to join our team. This role is critical in researching and analyzing data for various entities, tools, and datasets that will be introduced through on-the-job training. The ideal candidate should have a background in technology, with strong logical and analytical skills to assess data and provide valuable insights. While prior experience in similar roles is beneficial, we encourage candidates with some experience in data analysis, quality assurance, or related fields to apply, especially those looking to grow their skills in a global, dynamic work environment. Key Responsibilities Data Interpretation: Analyze datasets, translating raw data into actionable insights that can support business improvement strategies. Data Manipulation: Handle data batches, apply labeling techniques, and manipulate data according to project requirements, ensuring high accuracy. Quality Assurance: Oversee the quality of training data, identify issues or anomalies, and implement corrective measures to maintain data integrity. Language Translations: Provide translations and contextual understanding where necessary to ensure data is aligned with language and cultural nuances. Recommendations: Offer suggestions aimed at improving business processes and outcomes based on your data analysis. Desired Qualifications Some experience in data labeling, manipulation, or quality assurance, particularly in technology or related fields. A proactive attitude towards continuous improvement, staying updated with new advancements in AI technologies and data analysis techniques. Logical and analytical skills to ensure data accuracy and support project goals. Required Skills Proficient in Korean and English. Excellent logical reasoning and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex datasets and derive meaningful insights. Experience with data labeling and manipulation techniques, ensuring accuracy and reliability in data processing. Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data quality issues. Required Qualifications Proficiency (reading, writing, and/or speaking) in Korean and English. Strong computer skills, particularly in typing and writing. Meticulous attention to detail. Proactive attitude with a commitment to fostering positive experiences for others. If you are certified as a Linguist, it is considered a plus! Interview Process Submissions are reviewed by a recruiter. Selected candidates will be invited to complete an Applicant Response Form and may be invited to a first and final interview. Additional Requirements Must have own device (laptop/desktop). Currently hiring for Freelance/Task-based (ranging from 0 to 20 hours a week!). Candidate must be available in IST (preferred 8am IST onwards). Must have access to good Wi-Fi connection during working hours. This role is a 1099 independent contractor position. Please note that this classification may vary based on your location and local regulations. For most candidates outside of the US, a W-8 BEN form is provided. Onboarding & Compliance Requirements All global contractors will be onboarded through our platform, Deel.com, to ensure alignment with international compliance standards. Successful completion of onboarding is required to begin work, which includes submitting the necessary documentation within the specified timeline. Candidates should be prepared to provide accurate and compliant documents according to the requirements of their region. Compensation USD $5.00 to $10.00 per hour This is an exciting opportunity for a remote freelance position! Please kindly note that hours are dependent on the volume of tasks given by the client. Perfect for a supplemental income opportunity. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Lead Full-Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, WeChat Mini-Programs)
description: About the job About TableCheck TableCheck is a global platform built to help restaurants own their guest experience. We help merchants reduce their reliance on paid booking channels by directly converting first-time diners into repeat guests‚Äîand repeat guests into loyal fans. Used by over 10,000 restaurants in over 30 countries, including top hospitality brands and over 200 Michelin-starred restaurants, TableCheck has set new standards for restaurant management tools in Japan and is steadily growing to take on the challenge of becoming the world's leader in restaurant management. We operate in an English-first remote-first environment where clear communication and thorough documentation are paramount. TableCheck has embraced remote work. As such, communication and documentation are in our blood. We look for and write about signals in the noise which enables us to constantly learn and adapt, and we expect members of our teams to constantly follow up with questions and updates to keep everyone in the loop. Role Overview We're seeking a Lead Full-Stack Engineer to strengthen our China Squad in delivering exceptional products tailored for the Chinese market. Working under the supervision of the Engineering Manager, you will be a senior technical contributor and mentor who understands Chinese business culture and customer needs. You'll combine hands-on development expertise with the ability to guide technical decisions, helping the squad deliver high-quality products that resonate with our rapidly growing Chinese customer base. This role requires someone who excels at both frontend and backend development while understanding the unique requirements of the Chinese market. While there will be a strong focus on WeChat ecosystem integrations, you'll also work with various other Chinese platforms and payment systems. You'll be responsible for implementing complex features while mentoring other engineers and maintaining our high engineering standards. What we're looking for Required Qualifications 5+ years of full-stack development experience with strong proficiency in both frontend and backend Strong experience in Ruby on Rails and Javascript Hands-on experience with WeChat Mini-Programs development and WeChat ecosystem integrations Fluent Mandarin Chinese proficiency with deep understanding of Chinese business culture Fluent English communication skills for collaboration with global teams Experience with Chinese payment systems (WeChat Pay, Alipay, UnionPay) Strong ability to understand business requirements and passion for solving customer problems Nice to haves Experience with Ember.js or React for frontend development Familiarity with Chinese F&B industry and restaurant operations Experience with Chinese cloud providers (Alibaba Cloud, Tencent Cloud) Understanding of Chinese data privacy regulations and compliance requirements Personal Attributes Moves fast, has a strong bias for impact, and seeks forgiveness, not permission Strong communication and collaboration skills with a team-first mindset Excellent cross-cultural communication skills with ability to work effectively across different cultural contexts Interview Process Resume screening by HR. Please submit your resume/application in English. Resumes/applications submitted in any other language will be rejected. Cultural fit screening with HR(60 minutes) Async take-home assignment (~1 week, negotiable) Take-home review / technical interview call with the engineering manager and/or team members (60 minutes) Final interview with CTO (~1hr or less) Work Arrangement Remote-first position with flexibility to work from anywhere At least 4 hours overlap with our core hours of 11:00 ~ 19:00 GMT+9 is required. Occasional travel to China for client meetings and team gatherings may be required Join us in revolutionizing the restaurant industry in one of the world's most dynamic markets!

title: Junior Linux Kernel Engineer - Ubuntu
description: About the job Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing. Every year we select new junior professionals into the Canonical Kernel Team, to work on the Linux kernel for Ubuntu. If you‚Äôve enjoyed operating systems in your coursework or current role, you are confident in your ability to write high quality C and possibly Rust, and are ready to take the plunge and see how it all works, then this would be a great place to pursue your next career stage. We are a global team working to ship the world's most widely used Linux kernel, across the very latest silicon and cloud, where you can apply and grow your software engineering skills. The Canonical Kernel Team builds and maintains all supported Ubuntu Linux kernels for a variety of platforms and architectures from small embedded devices to standard desktop/server systems to large-scale cloud environments. In your first year you will tackle serious initiatives, which include but are not limited to: Optimized solutions for key Silicon and Cloud partner platforms Developer platforms such as Raspberry Pi and RISC-V Enabling Ubuntu on a wide range of embedded systems Security hardening and exploit mitigation Third-party driver integration and distribution, such as graphics Expanded driver support for bleeding-edge PC platforms We select candidates that are recent university graduates or early career professionals who are enthusiastic to develop kernel-level software in multiple areas including security updates, patching, and testing. The successful candidate will have a background in software engineering, be motivated to work in a distributed team and willing and able to travel globally twice a year for company engineering events. These are full-time positions available to prospective or recently graduated students. Location: We have home-based Kernel Teams in every timezone. The role entails Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team Learn from senior mentors to demystify the inner workings of the Linux kernel and how it is distributed Work closely with external silicon, cloud, or hardware manufacturer delivery teams on bleeding-edge platforms Diagnose and resolve issues in the kernel reported by customers, the community, and discovered by your own rigorous testing Take personal responsibility for the delivery of various flavors of the Ubuntu Linux kernel Improve tooling and automation for delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels Submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers What We Are Looking For In You Well-organized and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment Professional manner with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal Programming experience in C and/or Rust Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals Ability to travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks length Nice-to-have Skills Interest and experience in Rust Python and Bash scripting ability Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP‚Äôs, and other low level system engineering What We Offer Colleagues We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally. Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Experienced Software Engineer
description: About the job WordPress doesn‚Äôt try to keep its users inside walled gardens, a rare thing in a world that is dangerously moving away from the open web. Instead, WordPress gives them the freedom to build a business website, an online store, or a personal blog ‚Äì the way they like it. Big sites or small, using the community-run open source project or Automattic‚Äôs WordPress.com, vanilla or customized with hundreds of plugins, WordPress users always get to own and control their data, their expression, and their freedom. We‚Äôre always looking for talented and experienced engineers worldwide, excited to help Automattic‚Äôs product ecosystem, and join our mission to make the web a better place. What have we worked on recently? AI is at the heart of many new product developments and powers a lot of our day-to-day development workflows. WooCommerce is the most popular and most flexible e-commerce platform on the web. We're working tirelessly on giving you all the control, while keeping the platform fast and stable. Gutenberg is a new block-level editor for WordPress with clean abstractions for users, too, not just developers. Tumblr is a microblogging social network where users create, share, and follow what they love. To view more of our recent work, check out our longer product list on Automattic.com. How do we work? We‚Äôre kind to each other and our users ‚Äì we build a positive, supportive, and inclusive culture of cohesive teams focused on building useful products for our customers. We work as a global and distributed workforce resulting in a unique way of working built around our creed. We offer flexible work arrangements allowing our team members to work when they feel best. We open-source! We‚Äôre cool with open-sourcing everything except passwords, or secret keys. We ship often, deploying many times daily with the help of peer code review, continuous integration, and our global workforce in over 70 countries. We welcome collaboration, and you can be involved in any discussion across our many communication channels. We encourage you to learn and develop and we support you with what you need ‚Äì covering expenses, easy internal mobility, coaching. Enough about us, let‚Äòs talk more about you. Working at Automattic might be a good fit if: You care and often obsess over the quality and the details of your work. Debugging any problem is a fun challenge and not a chore. Understanding the layers of abstraction below and above your work isn't something extra, but how you operate. You have production experience with several programming languages, frameworks, and paradigms. We mostly use PHP and JavaScript at Automattic, we expect you to be comfortable with the idea of becoming an expert in these languages, even if being one isn't a requirement to apply. In your mind abstraction is associated as much with cost as it is with value. You have experience working at scale ‚Äì it can be on the backend and performance side, or via the complexity of interacting with a multi-million diverse userbase. Are open and able to travel 3-4 weeks per year to meet up with your teammates in person. These are exciting times at Automattic and you‚Äôll have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our products. Join us! We look forward to hearing from you. Curious who works in engineering at Automattic? Meet our Code Wranglers ‚Äì Brandon, Jeremy, Mark, Jennifer, Roy and Kat! What to Expect: We know applying to jobs can be stressful and we want to ease the stress by giving clear expectations upfront about our process. We‚Äôve outlined everything you need to know here including all of the steps in the process as well as how we approach hiring. Please note that we are paying extra attention to your answers to the questions in the application form. They are a significant part of the hiring process, and we will review them just like we would review any other step of the hiring process. We‚Äôre always iterating so if you happen to join us in the process, please feel free to offer feedback on what else we can include there! Salary range: $70,000-$170,000 USD. Please note that salary ranges are global, regardless of location, and we pay in local currency. We are searching for high-caliber candidates with the skills and qualities to have a net positive for Automattic. Pay will reflect the potential contribution and the impact you can bring, which may, in some cases, go beyond the range stated. We‚Äôre pleased to offer a straightforward, competitive base salary, providing financial clarity without complex variable components. This isn‚Äôt your typical work-from-home job: we are a fully-remote company with an open vacation policy. To see a full list of benefits by country, consult our Benefits Page. And check out these links to learn more about How We Hire and What We Expect from Ourselves. ABOUT AUTOMATTIC Now in our 20th year, we‚Äôre the people behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, Tumblr, Simplenote, Jetpack, Longreads, Day One, PocketCasts, Beeper, and more. We believe in making the web a better place. We‚Äôre a distributed company with more than 1400 Automatticians in nearly every corner of the globe, speaking over a hundred different languages. Enriched by this diversity, we‚Äôre united by a singular mission: to democratize publishing, commerce, and messaging so anyone with a story can tell it, anyone with a product can sell it, and everyone can manage their communications from a single source. In short, we help maintain a balance in society, creating and continually refining powerful tools people can use to compete fairly‚Äîregardless of income, gender, politics, language, or where they live in the world. We believe in Open Source, and the vast majority of our work is available under the GPL. Automattic is a Most Loved Company and Disability Confident Committed. (Here‚Äôs what that might mean for you.) Learn more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion and our Employee Resource Groups. If you need disability-related accommodations during the application or interview process, please fill out this form. We are committed to ensuring an accessible hiring process for all candidates. To learn about how we handle your data, please review our Privacy Policy. You can track your application status and more at MyGreenhouse. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: English AI Trainer - Writers
description: About the job This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI. What we do The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe. About the Role If you‚Äôre a professional who works with text, Mindrift offers a unique opportunity to apply your writing, editing, and creative and communication skills to an AI training project. As an AI Trainer - Writer, your work will help train AI models, shaping how they understand and generate human-like text. This isn‚Äôt just traditional writing‚Äîyou‚Äôll be crafting text that teaches AI reasoning, logic accuracy, nuance, and clarity. This is a freelance role for short-term projects, and your typical tasks may include: Crafting original, clear, and fact-checked responses based on project guidelines. Following style and quality standards to ensure consistency. Collaborating with Quality Assurance Specialists to refine and improve content. How to get started Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you‚Äôll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone. Requirements You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in any subject field. You have at least 1 year of professional or educational experience in any field. Your level of English is proficient (C2). You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines. Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge. Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you? Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $15/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs. Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments. Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio. Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise.

title: Korean Language Reviewer - AI trainer
description: About the job Job Title: Korean Language Reviewer - AI Trainer Job Type: Part-time Location: Remote Job Summary: Become a key contributor to our customer‚Äôs team as a Korean Language Reviewer - AI Trainer. In this remote, part-time role, you will leverage your deep understanding of the Korean language and culture to evaluate, refine, and advance the linguistic capabilities of AI-driven technologies. Play a vital part in ensuring the authenticity, fluency, and accuracy of AI-generated Korean content. Key Responsibilities: Review and analyze AI-generated Korean text and voice data for linguistic accuracy and natural expression. Assess and differentiate between native and non-native Korean speech and writing patterns. Deliver comprehensive feedback to improve AI comprehension of Korean grammar, idioms, and regional nuances. Collaborate with technical teams to enhance AI voice models, with a focus on accent recognition and clarity. Annotate and evaluate datasets for pronunciation, vocabulary, and language quality. Support the development of robust frameworks for native Korean identification and language assessment. Maintain thorough documentation of evaluations and actively engage in quality assurance processes. Required Skills and Qualifications: Native-level proficiency in Korean with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to identify and assess diverse Korean accents and dialects. Academic background in Korean Studies, Linguistics, or a related field. Meticulous attention to detail and a passion for language excellence. Experience in content reviewing, editing, language assessment, or similar roles. Proven skill in delivering clear, actionable, and constructive feedback. Self-driven and capable of producing top-quality work independently in a remote environment. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with AI training, speech data annotation, or machine learning projects targeting the Korean language. Knowledge of voice-based technologies or involvement in linguistic resource development. Advanced degree or recognized certification in Korean linguistics or related disciplines.

title: Freelance English Transcriber
description: About the job Job Freelance English Scripting Editor / English Scripting Transcriber Position Summary Scripting transcribers work with audiovisual content to create Dialogue Lists, which are an essential part of the dubbing process. Dialogue lists are essential for dubbing studios for recording and dubbing dialogue into other languages. Dialogue Lists may include the following: an economical description of the scenes or action of the film impeccable verbatim transcription of the audio including dialogue and nonverbal elements that accurately represent the content and nature of the project descriptive and context-based annotations to ensure proper translation and treatment of the material identification of the people or characters who narrate or recite the dialogue of the project timecode that shows where in the film these elements appear. General Requirements Native level proficiency of US/ UK English (IRL Level 5) an excellent knowledge of grammar, spelling and punctuation and ongoing engagement with the language cultural sensitivity and extensive understanding of terminological/cultural nuances deep understanding of culture from the region. Is a plus: Knowledge of cinema and the film industry not limited to film history, global & local cinema trends etc. but also include the business side of the industry. Is a plus: Degree and/or professional training in Dubbing, subtitling and media OR audiovisual localization of any kind. Is a plus:2 years of experience in review, editing, proofreading. Is a plus: Degree and/or professional training in dubbing or text/video/audio editing. Key Competencies Creation of Empty Shell files scripts for non-English content, including timing dialogue boxes and adding nonverbal element like character tagging. English verbatim transcription of the audio including dialogue and nonverbal elements that accurately represent the content and nature of the project. Creation of explanatory and context-based annotations to ensure faithful transcription of English material. Familiarity with and excellent comprehension of a wide variety of dialects and accents for the source language. Can research independently and apply subjective judgement Can adapt to new specs and requirements and apply knowledge to unexpected scenarios Please note, only suitable applicants to this role will be contacted to take this further.

title: Reading and Writing Teacher
description: About the job Teach online at Cosmo 1:1! Join Cosmo 1:1 (formerly ClassUp), the premiere online learning platform that connects K-12 students in the US, Canada, and across Asia with tutors from top Universities and Colleges for personalized lessons. As a tutor for Cosmo 1:1, you will have a flexible and consistent schedule that you set. For this role you'll be teaching ESL students based in APAC using the Cosmo curriculum. This is the perfect opportunity for experienced educators to connect with students in an after school setting. You will meet with your students at a set time each week for 50 minute 1 on 1 lessons. As a Cosmo 1:1 tutor you will build a welcoming and fun learning environment for your student as you help them grow. It is important for our teachers to be reliable role models for our students who come to class well prepared, on time, and with a passionate and kind demeanor. The pay rate for this position is $20 Singapore dollars per class plus additional incentives. Cosmo Teacher Responsibilities: Provide personalized 1 on 1 instruction for your students Update your availability in the Cosmo App in a timely manner Prepare appropriate lesson materials for the student's age and ability Submit Class Feedback after each lesson Communicate with parents and students in a professional manner Attend all classes on time and in a professional setting Communicate with Cosmo staff Minimum Requirements: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree 3 years of experience teaching grades K-12 in ELA Experience with K-12 ELA standards Teaching qualification preferred but not required Fast and reliable internet connection and access to a Windows or Mac PC with a minimum CPU of 6000 Able to commit to a minimum of 6 months of teaching with Cosmo1:1 Available between 3-8 PM Hong Kong Time Zone on Monday through Friday or during the weekends Minimum of 20 hours of availability on a weekly basis Access to a private and quiet location Passion for helping students learn Cosmo 1:1 Teachers are: Approachable: They are able to build rapport and make students feel comfortable in an online classroom environment. Students feel comfortable approaching our teachers with questions and make them feel relaxed throughout class. Patient:They take the time and effort to make sure students understand the complex subjects and materials at whichever speed is required by the student. Adaptive: They are able to tailor the lesson and environment to each individual student, their needs and learning capabilities. Considerate: They have the emotional intelligence to understand when a student is feeling discouraged and can then build up their confidence from there. Enthusiastic: They are passionate about education and have a contagious energy that makes for a fun environment for the students. Reliable: They come to class on time, prepared, and ready to tackle the students needs.

title: Senior Flutter Developer - Health & Education Technology Platform
description: About the job üåü Senior Flutter Developer - Health & Education Technology Platform üèõ About Our Client Our client is building a category‚Äëdefining health and education technology platform that transforms how children, families, and professionals connect. Their ecosystem integrates Medicaid billing, compliance, and multi‚Äëstakeholder applications into a seamless, scalable solution with national growth potential. This is not a routine developer role. It is an invitation to join a mission‚Äëdriven, founder‚Äëled organisation operating at the highest standards of speed, precision, and impact. üíº The Role We are seeking a Senior Flutter Developer of exceptional calibre to join the team ASAP. You will be entrusted with delivering features that directly influence sales success, pilot adoption, and long‚Äëterm platform architecture. This role demands independence, initiative, and technical mastery. You will be expected to think strategically, execute rapidly, and raise the bar for what's possible in Flutter development. üîß Key Responsibilities Sales Enablement: Build a polished, responsive demo app to showcase to prospective clients Product Evolution: Extend the Flutter app with advanced features (e.g., dictation) and adapt it for multiple therapy specialisms Technical Stewardship: Assess the Ruby on Rails backend, identify technical debt, and propose refactoring strategies Operate as a trusted technical partner to the senior leadership team Requirements üéØ Candidate Profile Proven track record of shipping Flutter/Dart applications at scale Mastery of mobile architecture, state management, and performance optimisation Analytical mindset with the ability to diagnose and improve backend systems Exceptional English communication skills and presence in cross‚Äëfunctional settings Thrives in fast‚Äëmoving, high‚Äëexpectation environments Bonus: experience in healthtech, edtech, or compliance‚Äëdriven platforms Benefits üí∞ Compensation & Logistics Salary: Dependent on expertise/experience Start Date: November 2025/ASAP Location: Remote (US or Europe time zones) Engagement: Full‚Äëtime üåç Why This Role is Different Operate at the intersection of elite technology and meaningful social impact Join a founder‚Äëcalibrated team that values clarity, adaptability, and uncompromising standards Shape a platform with national expansion potential Work on AI‚Äëpowered, compliance‚Äëcritical applications that demand precision and creativity ‚ö° Exclusive Recruitment Partnership EQL EdTech are the exclusive recruitment partner for this appointment. All applications and early shortlisting will be managed directly by us, ensuring a rigorous, high‚Äëbar process that admits only the most exceptional candidates. title: Golang Backend Developer | Remote | Part-Time | $200/hr)
description: About the job Backend Software Engineer (Go) Hourly Contract | Part-Time Remote | $200 per hour (average inclusive of bonuses) 1. About the Role Mercor is partnering with leading AI research labs to engage experienced Backend Software Engineers (Go) in high-impact projects that advance the reasoning and development capabilities of next-generation AI systems. In this role, you will help design, build, and validate backend coding benchmarks that simulate real-world engineering workflows. Your contributions will directly support AI model training and evaluation efforts across the Go ecosystem, ensuring accurate understanding of production-level backend engineering. This is a part-time, fully remote opportunity ideal for engineers looking to apply their backend expertise toward cutting-edge AI research and development. 2. Key Responsibilities Develop and validate coding benchmarks in Go, curating issues, solutions, and test suites from real-world repositories. Ensure all benchmarks include comprehensive unit and integration tests for precise solution verification. Maintain consistency, scalability, and reproducibility across benchmark tasks. Provide structured feedback and reviews on solution clarity, performance, and design patterns. Debug, optimize, and document benchmark code to meet professional backend engineering standards. 3. Ideal Qualifications 3‚Äì10 years of experience as a backend software engineer, ML engineer, or applied data scientist. Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Strong proficiency in Go (Golang). Experience with debugging, testing, and validating backend systems. Excellent attention to detail and ability to communicate technical reasoning clearly. Comfortable working independently in a remote, asynchronous environment. 4. Project Timeline Start Date: Immediate Duration: 1 month Commitment: Part-time (15‚Äì20 hours/week) Schedule: Fully remote and asynchronous ‚Äî flexible working hours 5. Compensation & Contract Terms Base Rate: $90/hour Bonus: Additional pay per approved benchmark task (each task ‚âà 1 hour) Median Effective Pay: ~$200/hour (inclusive of bonuses) Classification: Independent Contractor (via Mercor) Payments: Daily via Stripe Connect for completed and approved work 6. Application & Onboarding Process Upload your resume to begin the process. Complete a short AI-led interview (‚âà15 minutes) discussing your experience and technical background. Take a brief coding assessment to evaluate real-world coding, debugging, and problem-solving ability. Receive follow-up communication and onboarding details within a few days if selected. ‚ö° PS: Mercor reviews applications daily. Please complete your interview and onboarding steps to be considered for this opportunity. ‚ö°

title: Software Engineer
description: About the job AppCurators Technologies is a leading custom software development company, dedicated to building high-performance mobile apps, web platforms, and digital solutions tailored to your business vision. With a passion for innovation and a deep understanding of industry-specific needs, we empower startups, SMEs, and enterprises across domains like FinTech, EdTech, Health & Fitness, Gaming, and E-commerce. Our team of experienced designers, developers, and strategists believes in transforming ideas into intuitive, scalable, and user-centric digital products. From MVP development to full-scale deployment, we offer end-to-end services that ensure speed, quality, and growth. Why AppCurators? Industry-specific expertise Agile & transparent development process Scalable tech architecture Strong UI/UX design focus Proven track record across global markets Whether you're a non-tech founder or an established business, we‚Äôre your trusted partner in creating apps that not only function flawlessly ‚Äî but also make a real impact. The Role You Will Be Responsible For Writing well-designed, testable and efficient code. Gathering and evaluating user feedback. Working as a part of a dynamic team to deliver winning products. Providing code documentation and other inputs to technical documents. Supporting continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and new technologies and presenting these for architectural review. Troubleshooting and debugging to optimise performance. Leading the design, creation, and implementation of a suite of software. Building on new features, software analysis, software design, code implementation, software integration, module verification and validation. Ideal Profile You possess a Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field. You have at least 4 years experience, ideally within a Software Architect or Software Engineer role. You are a strong networker & relationship builder You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data You are adaptable and thrive in changing environments What's on Offer? Excellent career development opportunities Flexible working options Leadership Role

title: Backend Development Engineer Intern--Workflow
description: About the job About Bybit Established in March 2018, Bybit is one of the fastest growing cryptocurrency derivatives exchanges, with more than 70 million registered users. We offer a professional platform where crypto traders can find an ultra-fast matching engine, excellent customer service and multilingual community support. We provide innovative online spot and derivatives trading services, mining and staking products, as well as API support, to retail and institutional clients around the world, and strive to be the most reliable exchange for the emerging digital asset class. Our core values define us. We listen, care, and improve to create a faster, fairer, and more humane trading environment for our users. Our innovative, highly advanced, user-friendly platform has been designed from the ground-up using best-in-class infrastructure to provide our users with the industry's safest, fastest, fairest, and most transparent trading experience. Built on customer-centric values, we endeavour to provide a professional, 24/7 multi-language customer support to help in a timely manner. As of today, Bybit is one of the most trusted, reliable, and transparent cryptocurrency derivatives platforms in the space. Job Description We are looking for an intern passionate about BPMN workflow engines and modern web development. You will join our core backend development team, participating in the design, development, and optimization of a high-performance, highly available Workflow platform based on Camunda. You will be responsible for real-world product feature development and directly address the technical challenges of enterprise-level applications. Main Responsibilities Backend Development (Core): Participate in the integration, secondary development, and API design of the Camunda workflow engine. Develop workflow-related business services using Java/Spring Boot, such as workflow definition and deployment, task processing, and historical data querying. Write efficient and reliable code, and perform unit and integration testing. Assist in the design and performance optimization of databases (such as MySQL). Frontend Development (Collaborative): Develop the management console interface that interacts with the workflow engine using modern frontend frameworks (primarily React). Implement the user interface for functions such as the workflow designer, task forms, and workflow monitoring dashboards. Ensure smooth integration and data exchange between the frontend and backend RESTful APIs. Collaboration and Learning: Work closely with senior engineers on the team, participating in code reviews, technical discussions, and solution design. Quickly understand business requirements and translate them into technical implementations. Job Requirements Education/Major: Undergraduate/graduate student majoring in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Backend Fundamentals (Required): Proficient in Java and object-oriented programming; practical project or course design experience with Spring/Spring Boot frameworks. Must have practical experience in Java-related projects. Familiarity with common workflow engines or workflow design, and some understanding of microservices and database sharding are preferred. Frontend Fundamentals: Basic knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript; understanding and experience using at least one mainstream frontend framework such as Vue.js or React. Learning Ability: Strong ability to learn quickly and solve problems; passionate about technology; eager to work on enterprise-level open-source projects; able to withstand pressure; and committed to code quality. Communication and Collaboration: Excellent team communication and collaboration skills.

title: Freelance Photographer (Remote)
description: About the job We're Hiring Photography Experts | Earn up to $7,000/Month About the Role We are hiring experienced photographers for one of our prime clients ‚Äî a leading AI research organisation ‚Äî to contribute to an innovative project blending creativity, photography, and artificial intelligence. This short-term engagement offers a unique opportunity for visual artists to apply their expertise toward the development of next-generation AI models. If you have a passion for creative experimentation and a meticulous approach to image quality, this project is for you. Key Responsibilities Capture and deliver original, high-resolution photographs following project guidelines. Ensure visual consistency across images, including lighting, framing, and composition. Interpret and execute creative or unconventional visual prompts. Upload, tag, and organise images according to defined file formats. Write clear, descriptive annotations for each image, detailing content, context, and style. Ideal Qualifications Proven experience in commercial, editorial, or artistic photography. Strong written communication skills to describe visual content effectively. Ability to work independently and interpret open-ended creative briefs. Comfort with digital submission and collaboration tools. Role Details Type: Part-time, Independent Contractor Location: 100% Remote Schedule: Flexible and asynchronous ‚Äî manage your own working hours Commitment: Approximately 20 hours per week (may extend based on performance and output) Compensation: $45/hour (based on task completion and quality review) Why Join Collaborate on a cutting-edge AI research initiative with global impact. Apply your creative and technical photography skills in an experimental environment. Gain recognition and experience in an emerging intersection of art and technology. Apply Now!

title: AI Data Annotator with Traditional Chinese
description: About the job We are seeking a detail-oriented and meticulous AI Data Annotator to join our team for a multilingual project. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the development of next-generation AI by accurately annotating voice and text conversations. Your work will directly improve the performance and quality of machine learning models. Key Responsibilities Text Annotation: Accurately label text conversations according to project guidelines. This includes identifying and categorizing specific entities, sentiment, and intent within the text Voice Annotation: Listen to audio recordings and perform precise data annotation, which may include transcribing speech, identifying speaker changes, and labeling different parts of the conversation Apply clear and consistent labels to both text and voice data, ensuring high-quality output Follow project-specific instructions and guidelines diligently to meet quality standards Work independently and manage your time effectively to meet project deadlines Required Skills & Qualification Fluent in Traditional Chinese and English with excellent comprehension and grammar skills in both languages Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy over repetitive tasks Comfortable working with digital tools and platforms for data annotation Excellent time management and organizational skills Prior experience in data labeling, annotation, or transcription is a plus If you are passionate about contributing to the future of AI and have strong linguistic skills, we encourage you to apply! How to Apply: To apply, please submit your CV and complete the application form here. As part of our screening, shortlisted candidates will complete a test to demonstrate their data labeling experience. Successful candidates will join our TaskVerse community and gain access to additional opportunities in the AI space. Important Note As an AI Data Annotator, your work may include exposure to sensitive or potentially challenging content within both text and voice data. It is essential that you are comfortable handling such material professionally and objectively, as this work is critical for building safer and more ethical AI systems.

title: QA Engineer (Contractor) - Fintech / Payments / Web3
description: About the job About us Our Client is a PayFi network that delivers cutting-edge payment technology solutions worldwide that seeks to disrupt traditional cross border payment systems by allowing local stablecoin issuers to build their liquidity pools while providing near real time and ultra-low cost payments and remittance solutions. They have a well established presence of more than 100 different locations, supporting both fiat and a wide range of cryptocurrencies. Responsibilities ‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain automated testing frameworks (UI and API) ‚Ä¢ Conduct manual and exploratory testing for new and existing features ‚Ä¢ Work closely with product managers and developers to understand feature requirements and edge cases ‚Ä¢ Ensure regression coverage for multi-entity backend services, KYC flows, and transaction systems ‚Ä¢ Identify bugs, document issues clearly, and track resolution ‚Ä¢ Take part in release testing and ensure end-to-end quality in production deployments ‚Ä¢ Build testing documentation and contribute to QA best practices across the team Requirements ‚Ä¢ 3 years of hands-on QA engineering experience in web and backend testing ‚Ä¢ Experience in building and maintaining automation test frameworks (e.g. Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Postman, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with testing RESTful APIs, authentication flows, KYC, and transactional logic ‚Ä¢ Strong debugging and analytical skills ‚Ä¢ Experience with Git, CI/CD tools (e.g. GitHub Actions, Jenkins, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and communicate effectively in a remote environment ‚Ä¢ Good understanding of agile development and QA processes ‚Ä¢ Good proficiency in both english and mandarin speaking skills to communicate effectively with both english and mandarin speaking stakeholders

title: Frontend Engineer (DeFi / Web3 Protocol) - React / Typescript
description: About the job This is a fully remote role About the Company Our Client is a leading DeFi money market on BNB Smart Chain, powering decentralized lending, borrowing, and stablecoin generation for millions of users. As one of the Top DeFi protocol with billions in total value locked, redefining open finance by making liquidity accessible, efficient, and borderless. About the Role We are seeking a talented Frontend Engineer to craft intuitive and performant user experiences for our DeFi protocol. You will collaborate closely with product and design teams to deliver responsive, user-centric interfaces while integrating with smart contracts and backend services. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain frontend features using React and TypeScript. Build modern, responsive UIs with Tailwind CSS. Integrate smart contract interactions using Viem, ethers.js, or web3.js. Implement efficient data flows with GraphQL. Write reliable, well-tested code with Jest or Vitest. Continuously iterate on product features to optimize performance and usability. Qualifications: 3‚Äì5+ years of experience building web applications. Strong proficiency in React and TypeScript. Experience with Viem, ethers.js, or web3.js for blockchain integration. Familiarity with GraphQL and frontend testing frameworks. Bonus: Experience with wagmi, Yup/Zod, or React Hook Form.

title: Agent Evaluation Analyst (Freelance)
description: About the job Company Intro At Toloka AI we create data that powers leading GenAI models and innovations. We work with frontier labs, big tech, renowned AI startups, enterprises and non-profit research organizations worldwide. We use a combination of Experts + Crowd + Tech Platform to teach AI models to reason and evaluate their efficacy and safety. We have experts in more than 50 different domains-from doctors and lawyers to physicists and engineers-and boast one of the most diverse global crowds, representing over 100 countries and speaking 40+ languages. We are a well-funded startup with an enviable portfolio of clients including Anthropic, Amazon, Microsoft, poolside, Recraft, and Shopify. Recently, we secured strategic investment led by Bezos Expeditions with participation from Mikhail Parakhin, CTO of Shopify and board advisor to leading GenAI companies, who now serves as our Chairman of the Board. Our remote-first team is globally distributed around the world: USA, UK, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more. We are headquartered in Amsterdam. About the Role We are looking for an Freelance Agent Evaluation Analyst to take ownership of quality, structure, and insight across the project. This role goes far beyond task-checking - it‚Äôs about critical thinking, systems-level analysis, and ensuring clarity, reliability, and consistency at scale. You‚Äôll work as both a hands-on evaluator and an analyst, collaborating with domain experts, delivery managers, and engineers. Beyond reviewing outputs, you‚Äôll be expected to understand the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the work, identify logical gaps or inconsistencies, and propose meaningful improvements. This is a flexible, impact-driven role where you‚Äôll have space to grow, contribute ideas, and help shape how evaluation and quality are scaled across the project. This role is especially well-suited for: Analysts, researchers, or consultants with strong structuring and reasoning skills Junior product managers or strategists curious about AI and evaluation work Smart problem-solvers (students or early-career professionals) who enjoy digging into logic, systems, and edge cases You do not need a coding background. What matters most is curiosity, intellectual rigor, and the ability to evaluate complex setups with precision. What you‚Äôll be doing Fully own the QA pipeline for agent evaluation tasks; Review and validate tasks and golden paths created by scenario writers and experts; Spot logical inconsistencies, vague requirements, hidden risks, and unrealistic assumptions; Provide structured feedback and ensure quality alignment across contributors; Train, onboard, and mentor new QA team members; Collaborate with domain experts, delivery managers, and engineers to improve test clarity and coverage; Maintain and improve QA checklists, SOPs, and review guidelines; Contribute to test planning, prioritization, and quality benchmarks; Take initiative to suggest new approaches, tools, and processes that help scale validation and analysis. What you should know / be able to do Strong analytical and critical thinking skills; Attention to detail and reliability - your work can be trusted without double-checking; Experience in manual QA, scenario validation, or similar analytical work; Comfortable working with structured formats (JSON/YAML); Clear written communication and documentation skills; Ability to give constructive feedback and coach others; Capable of working with a wide range of stakeholders: from engineers to directors/VPs. Nice to have Background in scenario-based testing, test design, or annotation workflows; Experience with AI/LLM evaluation, prompt validation, or agent behavior testing; Some technical independence (e.g., Python skills); Familiarity with MCP / tool-based task execution; Experience working in cross-functional teams across product, delivery, and engineering. Who you are Detail-obsessed but also able to see the bigger picture; Proactive, independent, and take true ownership of your work; Strong communicator who can turn complex findings into actionable insights; Flexible and motivated to contribute across a variety of tasks and projects; Believe quality is not just checking work, but making the whole product better. What we can offer Freelance contract (B2B); Flexible payment based on the results of work; Flexibility: we offer freelance employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you; Hourly rate: from 20 to 60 $ (final amount to be determined after the final interview with the team). Friendly community.

title: Web 3 Crypto Card Payment Product Manager
description: About the job About us Bitget Wallet is the non-custodial crypto wallet designed to make crypto simple and secure for everyone. With over 80 million users, we bring together a full suite of crypto services, including swaps, market insights, staking, rewards, DApp exploration, and payment solutions. Supporting 130+ blockchains and millions of tokens, Bitget Wallet enables seamless multi-chain trading across hundreds of DEXs and cross-chain bridges. Backed by a $300+ million user protection fund, it ensures the highest level of security for users' assets. What you'll do Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle for Web3 card products (e.g., U Card), including virtual and physical card issuance, binding, payments, and user experience optimization. Deeply understand the Visa and MasterCard network, including integration processes, settlement flows, security, and compliance requirements. Collaborate with compliance and risk teams to design and refine KYC processes, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements across different regions. Work closely with growth and marketing teams to develop and execute user acquisition, activation, and retention strategies for card users. Manage partnerships and integrations with issuing banks, card networks (Visa/MasterCard), and payment processors to ensure operational excellence. Analyze product and user data to drive continuous improvements in product experience and business metrics. Explore and drive innovation in Web3-native use cases for cards, such as on-chain top-ups, NFT-linked cards, and decentralized identity integrations. What you'll need 3+ years of experience in fintech, payments, or internet product management; hands-on experience with virtual/physical card products is a strong plus. Solid understanding of Visa/MasterCard payment rails, clearing & settlement, and card lifecycle management. Familiar with KYC/KYT processes, AML standards, and regulatory frameworks in regions like Singapore and the EU. Good understanding of Web3 ecosystems, including wallets (e.g., MetaMask, Bitget Wallet), on-chain transactions, and basic blockchain concepts. Proven experience in driving user growth with structured product methodologies. Strong analytical, communication, and cross-functional collaboration skills. Fluent in English; able to manage international partners and teams. Bonus: Direct experience working on a Web3 card product (e.g„ÄÇ Crypto.com Card, Bitget U Card, etc.). Strong communicator, billingualand team player. If you are ambitious and believe that digital assets could be the next financial and technological revolution, please apply! By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Facebook Ads Specialist
description: About the job About Us: At 411 Locals, we empower small businesses worldwide through collaboration and innovation. Our mission is to provide simplified, effective, and affordable business services, enabling entrepreneurs to start, grow, and run their ventures with confidence. Join our team and be part of an environment that fosters growth, achieves results, and embraces constant innovation. Together, we create win-win-win outcomes for our customers, the company, and ourselves. Qualifications: BA/BS or equivalent working experience. Knowledge of the various paid marketing channels and technologies, including paid search (Google AdWords), retargeting, social network advertising. Experience creating ad creatives and perform A/B testing to identify high-performing designs and optimize campaign performance. Some experience handling marketing budgets and forecasting/reporting results. Good written communication skills Detailed-oriented and organized Enjoys learning new things Preferred Qualities (but not mandatory): Positive involvement with the SEO/PPC community Must stay on top of current trends and advancements in SEO/PPC technology Knowledge of Google AdWords and Microsoft Ad Center Knowledge of Google Analytics and Webmaster Tools Responsibilities: Launch and optimize various PPC campaigns Be involved in keyword selection and audience targeting Monitor budget and adjust bids to gain better ROI Track KPIs to assess performance and pinpoint issues based on KPIs and ROI Generating leads and sales using Facebook Ads Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends and potential new channels and strategies to keep us ahead, including updates to social media marketing, attribution, and programmatic media buying. Testing variations of ads to determine best performing Continuous monitoring of results and improving of ads Reporting of results of Facebook Campaigns Manage the strategy and setup of all paid campaigns. Work Conditions: The role is 100% remote, requiring effective communication with teams across different time zones. Regular virtual meetings and reporting sessions will be an integral part of the role. Flexible working hours with overlap for team collaboration may be required. Work Timings: 1:30 PM IST to 10:30 PM IST Key Performance Indicators: ROI and performance metrics of managed campaigns. Implementation and success rate of new strategies. Overall achievement of departmental goals and objectives. 411 Locals is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Golang Development Engineer (Mandarin Speaking)
description: About the job Job Responsibilities: Design and develop risk control systems, building stable and efficient real-time risk control platforms. Develop core risk control services using Go to meet high concurrency and low latency requirements. Integrate business risk control strategies, implementing rule engines and model serving. Collaborate with algorithm, data, and product teams to drive rapid iteration and optimization of risk control solutions. Continuously optimize system performance and stability, enhancing scalability and intelligence. Job Requirements: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields. Proficient in Go programming with strong coding skills and engineering practices. Familiar with distributed system architecture, experienced in developing highconcurrency and high-availability services. Familiar with commonly used middleware and databases such as Kafka, Redis, MySQL, and MongoDB. Experience in risk control, anti-fraud, or credit assessment projects is a plus. Experience with model deployment and rule engine development is a plus. Strong teamwork, communication, and business understanding skills.

title: Senior Blockchain Developer(Solidity/Smart Contract)
description: About the job General Information Salary range: Competitive, negotiable Position: Full-time Location: Remote Your Responsibilities Architect, implement, and test smart contracts in Solidity across EVM-compatible chains. Scope, design, and deliver complex systems end-to-end, from idea to deployment. Collaborate with cross functional partners on all aspects of product development. Conduct code reviews and enforce best practices for security, efficiency, and maintainability. Continuously evaluate and improve gas optimization, security design patterns, and upgradeability. Proactively identify areas for improvement and innovation within PancakeSwap‚Äôs protocol architecture. Skills & Qualifications 5+ years of software engineering experience, with 2+ years focused on Solidity smart contracts. Deep understanding of Solidity design patterns, gas optimization, and contract upgradeability. Hands-on experience with Hardhat and Foundry (understands the trade-offs and tooling ecosystems). Strong understanding of EVM internals, DeFi protocols, and on-chain architecture. Excellent analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills. Comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced, globally distributed team.
